channel.title: Distribution morphing Ubuntu into Kicksecure (kicksecure-cli-host for Ubuntu)
channel.description: While this thread is about `grub-live` issues with Ubuntu. Wouldn't it be best for Ubuntu users that want to take advantage of the hardening that Kicksecure offers to just install `kicksecure-cli-host` for the time being?

item.title: Distribution morphing Ubuntu into Kicksecure (kicksecure-cli-host for Ubuntu)
item.dc:creator: Quiksilver
item.description:
Shouldn’t a good starting point be:
apt install kicksecure-cli-host sdwdate sdwdate-gui tirdad

I thought security-misc can have issues?

Read full topic

item.title: Distribution morphing Ubuntu into Kicksecure (kicksecure-cli-host for Ubuntu)
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Kicksecure – 3 Sep 24

Other Operating Systems

How to distribution-morph Other Operating System into Kicksecure?

Kicksecure – 12 Oct 24

Undocumented, Untested or Unsupported Features

This feature is either undocumented, untested, or unsupported. Options: Become a Contributor / Apply Self Support First Policy / Purchase Support.

Read full topic
item.source: Distribution morphing Ubuntu into Kicksecure (kicksecure-cli-host for Ubuntu)

item.title: Distribution morphing Ubuntu into Kicksecure (kicksecure-cli-host for Ubuntu)
item.dc:creator: sam
item.description:
dependency conflict. you do not morph ubuntu to kicksecure. for example, you can not install kicksecure-network-conf package but you can greatly enhance ubuntu security - grub-live, security-misc, sdwdate, tirdad work and do not cause problems. I saw this topic and asked a friend to try installing packages on his ubuntu and check the system’s operation. he said that there are no failures, everything works fine - browsers, messengers, tor, vpn, dnscript-proxy. secure canonical

I think devs can write in wiki and github that grub-live and security-misc work in ubuntu. ubuntu users will look for increased security and get acquainted with kicksecure. when they get tired of ubuntu, they will switch to debian-kicksecure

Read full topic
item.source: Distribution morphing Ubuntu into Kicksecure (kicksecure-cli-host for Ubuntu)
